intro: Psoralea adscendens var. parva, commonly known as the small climbing psoralea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, trifoliate leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous annual or perennial, often found in sandy or rocky soils. Its small size and climbing habit make it a unique addition to native gardens and ecological studies.
